content: So, the first problem is how to propably show the sheaf of rings is a sheaf of commucative rings. Just adding instance dependency with [∀(X : Cᵒᵖ),CommRing (R.obj X)] won't work, since all other instance suggest that R is a ring is from (R .obj X) : RingCat, and ↑(R.obj X).instRingα_1(the instance from (R .obj X) : RingCat) doesn't meet with ↑(R.obj X).CommRing.toRing(the instance from ∀(X : Cᵒᵖ),CommRing (R.obj X)). Or I should define "(pre)sheaf of modules on sheaf of commucative rings"?
I don't know of any applications for sheaves of modules over noncommutative rings. Do people do modules over Azumaya algebras when thinking about Brauer groups?
no idea, but the definion on mathlib is only (pre)sheaf of modules on sheaf of (arbitrarily) rings, see# Presheaves of modules over a presheaf of rings
oh, they just add the tensor product of presheaf of modules, guess problem is solved
You can just take a presheaf in CommRingCat and a module over that is a module over its composition with CategoryTheory.forget₂.
